page.title: 04TIMSBURY WATER-LIFE
page.content: Eleven people took part in our survey. Five out of the eleven visited ponds in the area. These people had managed to catch a glimps of certain kinds of wildlife such as tadpoles, fish etc. The most common place people saw waterlilies was Emborough Pond. Some of the people thought that the public on the whole kept the ponds clean and did not throw their rubbish into them. Some of the people had seen dead water life, mostly fish. This might be due to pollution of the water although the source of the pollution is not known. Most people thought that waterlife should be protected to ensure that the balance of nature is maintained. Although no one took an active part in any conservation group,they said they would take action if they saw anyone deliberately harming waterlife. {By Joanne and Laura.
